availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles E. Phythian (Woodford County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Woodford County, Kentucky, farmer. Pennsylvania native. Son of Charles G. Phythian and Eliza Phythian. Student in Franklin County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned five enslaved persons in 1850. Farmer in Woodford, Kentucky in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 1, p. 43A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, p. 922.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Peaks Mill, p. 185A.
"Charley Phythian Dead," The Frankfort Roundabout (Frankfort, KY), November 14, 1891, p. 3.
